result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher P Czerpak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit - Court reserves ruling.  Atty. Rider to submit request in 10 days.  State to file response 10 days after.  Response received stating defendant is NOT entitled to any sentence credit on this case.  Any credit he received was put toward the revocation sentence he received.
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Sentence Being Served.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Defendant to Attend the Victim Impact Panel Meeting within 3 months of release onto Probation.

miscConds.notes:
Fine, Surcharges, Cost and Fee to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $100.00 per month starting the 6th month of release onto Extended Supervision/Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Blood Reimbursement Fee:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Case #14TR2451 was Dismissed and Read into Case #14CF559.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time:  180 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith.

AS OF 9/29/2015: Court allows defendant to have sentence transferred to Walworth County Huber facility, as long as they accept.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christopher P Czerpak in court, in custody, with attorney Andrew R Rider.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Plea Colloquy
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and readin. 

The Court Orders the Following:

COUNT 1
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of 

5 Years Imprisonment   CONSECUTIVE to sentence being served
- 2 Years of Initial Confinement
- 3 Years of Extended Supervision
(Credit - Court reserves ruling.  Atty. Rider to submit request in 10 days.  State to file response 10 days after)

Term of Probation: 3 Years  Consecutive to sentence being served

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- Inform agent of all prescriptions;
- Sign Medical Release for Agent;
- Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge

Condition Time: 180 days Huber NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence forthwith. 

FINE:  $1582.00  
DNA Surcharge: $250.00
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
(To be paid at the rate of $100.00  per month commencing the 6th month of release onto extended supervision/probation)

DL REVOCATION:  2 years.

IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 2 years.

Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel on: Within 3 months of release onto probation

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program




COUNT 3

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of 

3 Years Imprisonment   CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1 
- 1 Year of Initial Confinement
- 2 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 3 Years  CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1

Conditions of Probation: Same as Count 1

COSTS:  268.00  
DNA Surcharge: $250.00
(To be paid after costs in Count 1 at the same rate)

Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.
